channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Can Europe Talk to Trump? Macron Tries Flattery, and Gentle Resistance.
item.description: Emmanuel Macron, the French president, epitomized how the continent’s leaders are trying to navigate President Trump’s increasingly hostile administra...

item.title: Americans Brace for Inflation as Trump’s Tariffs Start to Take Effect
item.description: More Americans are starting to brace for higher prices as President Trump’s policies begin to take effect.

item.title: A government watchdog that was fired by Trump is trying to protect tens of thousands of federal workers from latest culling
item.description: The Office of Special Counsel’s findings could have major implications for fired federal workers trying to get their jobs back.

item.title: Bill Ackman urges everyone to buy this book: ‘The earlier you read this, the better your life will be,’ he says
item.description: Billionaires like Tim Cook are raving about the book, which reframes wealth to include social, time, mental, and physical prosperity.

item.title: Emil Bove, Justice Dept.’s No. 2, Targets NY Office Where He Rose as a Prosecutor
item.description: The forceful approach that Emil Bove III has taken toward the Southern District of New York underscores his own fraught relationship with the office t...

item.title: Supreme Court Grants New Trial to Death Row Inmate in Oklahoma
item.description: Both sides had told the justices that long-suppressed evidence had undermined the case the case against the inmate, Richard Glossip.

item.title: The top 10 car picks for 2025, as selected by Consumer Reports
item.description: Six of them are hybrids—and there’s one EV.

item.title: U.K. to Raise Defense Spending to 2.5% of G.D.P. by 2027, Starmer Says
item.description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer, who is set to meet with President Trump on Thursday, said he would increase British spending on defense to 2.5 percent of...

item.title: U.K. to Raise Defense Spending to 2.5% of G.D.P. by 2027, Starmer Says

item.title: Syria Begins National Dialogue but Without Kurdish-Led Militia
item.description: Although the conference was called to chart the country’s future, the Kurdish-led militia that controls much of Syria’s northeast was not invited.

item.title: German Central Bank Loss Points to More Economic Woes for Germany
item.description: The central bank’s president said it was “not possible to rule out” a third year of no economic growth.

item.title: Keir Starmer Announces Defense Spending Increase

item.description: Emmanuel Macron, the French president, epitomized how the continent’s leaders are trying to navigate President Trump’s increasingly hostile administra...

item.title: Train robbers have stolen nearly $2 million worth of rare Nike sneakers over the past year
item.description: Thefts have occurred in Arizona and California over the past year.

item.title: Elon Musk says federal workers have one more chance to list their accomplishments via email: ‘Failure to respond a second time will result in termination’
item.description: "The email request was utterly trivial, as the standard for passing the test was to type some words and press send!" Musk said.
